How to Install reconf-inetd on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • reconf-inetd

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install reconf-inetd on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing reconf-inetd on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall reconf-inetd in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install reconf-inetd, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install reconf-inetd Using apt

To install reconf-inetd in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install reconf-inetd using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install reconf-inetd

The installation of reconf-inetd might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install reconf-inetd Using apt-get

To install reconf-inetd using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install reconf-inetd.

sudo apt-get -y install reconf-inetd

Install reconf-inetd Using Synaptic

To install reconf-inetd using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install reconf-inetd on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for reconf-inetd. This will display the reconf-inetd package in the package window, now to install reconf-inetd, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the reconf-inetd package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of reconf-inetd.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install reconf-inetd Using aptitude

To install reconf-inetd on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of reconf-inetd.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install reconf-inetd using the command aptitude install reconf-inetd.

sudo aptitude -y install reconf-inetd

How to Upgrade reconf-inetd on debian

If you want to upgrade the reconf-inetd package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade reconf-inetd using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade reconf-inetd to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade reconf-inetd.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade reconf-inetd sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade reconf-inetd

Upgrade reconf-inetd using Aptitude

To upgrade reconf-inetd using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade reconf-inetd.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade reconf-inetd

Upgrade reconf-inetd using Synaptic

To upgrade reconf-inetd using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for reconf-inetd, now right-click reconf-inetd, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade reconf-inetd just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall reconf-inetd on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall reconf-inetd from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just reconf-inetd, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove reconf-inetd

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of reconf-inetd

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of reconf-inetd you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge reconf-inetd

Remove reconf-inetd using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall reconf-inetd using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for reconf-inetd, right-click the reconf-inetd package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall reconf-inetd click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install reconf-inetd on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade reconf-inetd using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of reconf-inetd then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
